item.title: Halifax mayor says rowdy university partiers lacked common sense in light of COVID-19
item.description: Dalhousie University students who attended a massive party that violated COVID-19 protocols should use more common sense -- and stay away from classes for one week and get tested, authorities say.
item.dc:creator: The Canadian Press

item.title: New Brunswick reports record 86 new COVID-19 cases on Monday, active cases rise to 650
item.description: Health officials in New Brunswick are reporting a single-day record 86 new cases of COVID-19 on Monday, as the total number of active cases in the province rises to 650.
item.dc:creator: Allan April

item.title: Nova Scotia reports 96th COVID-19 related death, 83 new cases over the weekend
item.description: Health officials in Nova Scotia are reporting 83 new cases of COVID-19 over the weekend, along with 46 recoveries, as the number of active cases in the province rises to 205.
item.dc:creator: Allan April

item.title: DNA evidence ties blood of alleged jail-beating victim to clothing of N.S. inmates
item.description: Prosecutors in the trial of inmates accused of attempting to murder a prisoner in his Nova Scotia jail cell have entered DNA evidence linking the victim's blood to three of the alleged assailants' clothing.
item.dc:creator: The Canadian Press
item.enclosure: The Central Nova Scotia Correctional Facility yard is seen in Dartmouth on Tuesday, May 15, 2018. (THE CANADIAN PRESS/Andrew Vaughan)

item.title: Inquiry into Nova Scotia mass killing holds first of four community open houses
item.description: About 50 people from the community of Debert, N.S., turned out to meet investigators from the commission of inquiry investigating the mass killing that claimed 22 lives in the central and northern parts of Nova Scotia last year.
item.dc:creator: The Canadian Press
item.enclosure: About 50 people from the community of Debert, N.S., turned out to meet investigators from the commission of inquiry investigating the mass killing that claimed 22 lives in the central and northern parts of Nova Scotia last year.

item.title: N.B. nursing home unions seek $4 per hour wage hike to address labour shortages
item.description: The New Brunswick Council of Nursing Home Unions is calling on the provincial government to increase wages for workers in long-term care homes in an effort to address a "crippling" staffing shortage that they say is leaving seniors with inadequate care.
item.dc:creator: The Canadian Press
item.enclosure: The New Brunswick Council of Nursing Home Unions is calling on the provincial government to increase wages for workers in long-term care homes by $4 per hour. (File photo)

item.title: Campus and community react to Dalhousie street party
item.description: Dalhousie University wants students who attended the street party to get a COVID-19 test and to stay away from classes while they await the results.
item.dc:creator: Paul Hollingsworth

item.title: Mixed messaging as Nova Scotia prepares to enter Phase 5 in October
item.description: Nova Scotia is scheduled to move into Phase 5 of its recovery plan on October 4 if all goes according to plan.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan MacInnis
item.enclosure: Gym owner Jackie Kellestine is concerned about a lack of communication between the province and the business community, making it unclear how the vaccine policy is to be handled moving forward.

item.title: Only indoor rink in Cape Bretonâ€™s Victoria County in danger of closing
item.description: The Victoria Highlands Civic Centre in Baddeck, N.S. is the only indoor arena for miles. It's nearly 50 years old and it's seen better days.
item.dc:creator: Ryan MacDonald
item.enclosure: The Victoria Highlands Civic Centre in Baddeck, N.S. is the only indoor arena for miles. It's nearly 50 years old and it's seen better days.

item.title: Bridgewater, N.S. man, woman facing drug trafficking charges
item.description: RCMP in Nova Scotia have charged a 31-year-old man and 35-year-old woman with drug trafficking after searching a home in Bridgewater, N.S. last week.
item.dc:creator: Allan April
item.enclosure: RCMP in Nova Scotia have charged a 31-year-old man and 35-year-old woman with drug trafficking after searching a home in Bridgewater, N.S. last week.
